situation.title: Certificate of Vaccination
situation.meta_description: Information about the document providing that you have been vaccinated.

content.processed:
The coronavirus pandemic complicated (not only) international transport, but many other businesses such as catering and accommodation which had to be closed. It has brought a lot of negative effects on our daily lives. The only hope we will be able to return to a pre-pandemic way of life is the vaccination.

Places which offer vaccination issue a certificate of vaccination to people after the application of the second dose. This template shows the certificate only in the Czech language. Any person is considered to have been vaccinated 7 days after the 2nd dose of vaccine. It is not immediately after the second dose, as the body needs some time to complete the immune response. However you will receive a certificate on the same day as you receive the second dose.

You will receive the certificate via the email by which you have signed in the register. However, the certificate itself is password protected.You receive the PIN via SMS. If you accidentally delete a certificate, please contact the vaccination center where you were vaccinated and they will resend the certificate. If you do not receive any SMS with a password, you should also contact the vaccination center to have the certificate sent to you again, or contact the ÚZIS Helpdesk (the methodological helpdesk applies to you). Do not forget to check that you have correctly entered the email and phone number.

links.title: Manuál ÚZIS k očkování proti covid-19

related_situations.title: How vaccination works? What will happen in my body?

questions_answers.question: How does the generation of an identity card number and passport number works?
questions_answers.value: The ID card and passport number is copied from the population register (ROB). If the person is not in ROB, the number is not copied.

questions_answers.question: What number will be filled in the certificate for foreigners?
questions_answers.value: The number of the insured person will be filled in by the doctor of the patient/foreigner.

questions_answers.question: How does the data are generated in the certificate for foreigners who's date are not in the ROB?
questions_answers.value: The ID card number and passport number will not be filled in for foreigners. In this case, the certificate is valid because it contains the name, surname and a date of birth.

questions_answers.question: In which countries will the vaccination certificate be valid?
questions_answers.value: The EU is validating the certificates and during summer the certification will be issued as internationally recognised. Negotiations with third countries will follow.
